data.title: CatalogScanner
data.meta_description: A simple bot for extracting your Animal Crossing: New Horizon catalog items, DIY recipes, critters and more from recorded videos or screenshost.
data.text:
Instructions

To use CatalogScanner, you need to closely follow the steps below and record using your Switch (not a camera). Then edit and export your file from the Switch, and use the Discord bot to scan it. Make sure to look at the included example.

Navigate to Nook Shopping (ATM or phone app)

Select the desired catalog, and optionally a subsection

Scroll to the bottom by holding down the right analog stick

Hold the "Capture" button (left joycon) to record the last 30s

Open Switch's Album gallery and select your video

Trim the video to the start & end of the scrolling

Tweet or extract the video from your Switch

Use the /scan command on the Discord bot,

passing the Twitter url or attachment file.

[Optional] Add integration hashtags (listed below)

[Optional] Add #ForSale to only scan sellable items

Navigate to the DIY recipes list (phone app)

Scroll to the bottom by holding down the left analog stick

Hold the "Capture" button (left joycon) to record the last 30s

Open Switch's Album gallery and select your video

Trim the video to the start & end of the scrolling

Use the /scan command on the Discord bot,

passing the Twitter url or attachment file.

[Optional] Add integration hashtags (listed below)

Navigate to the Critterpedia phone app

Make sure you are in List Mode (not Display Mode)

Move through every section to view all the critters

Hold the "Capture" button (left joycon) to record the last 30s

Open Switch's Album gallery and select your video

Trim the video to the start & end of the scrolling

Use the /scan command on the Discord bot,

passing the Twitter url or attachment file.

[Optional] Add integration hashtags (listed below)

Press ZR to open the Reactions Wheel

Press Y to access the full list of reactions

Move your cursor to the an empty spot or the top right corner

Press the "Capture" button (left joycon) to save a screenshot

Open Switch's Album gallery and select your screenshot

Use the /scan command on the Discord bot,

passing the Twitter url or attachment file.

[Optional] Add integration hashtags (listed below)
